citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS), National Geodetic Survey (NGS)
citeinfo.title: United States Cities, 2022

descript.abstract: U.S. Major Cities represents the locations of cities within the United States with populations of approximately 10,000 or greater, all state capitals, and the national capital.
descript.purpose: U.S. Major Cities provides the locations and 2020 U.S. Census class, codes, and population information for the major cities of the United States.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The spatial accuracy varies with the source materials used. The Census Bureau cannot specify the spatial accuracy of features changed or added by field staff or through local updates, features derived from the GBF/DIME Files (TIGER’s predecessor in 1970 and 1980), or other map or digital sources. The positional accuracy is unknown.

citeinfo.othercit: The initial source of this data is the 2020 Census Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied the Data and Maps 2022 U.S. Census Populated Place Points keeping only cities with populations of approximately 10,000 or greater, all state capitals, and the national capital. Joined the fields from the Data and Maps 2021 U.S. Cities to get the CAPITAL field.

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent the locations of cities within the United States with populations of approximately 10,000 or greater, all state capitals, and the national capital.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau
U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: An incorporated place in Connecticut, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: Census designated place - the statistical counterpart of an incorporated place, delineated to provide data for settled concentrations of population identifiable by name but not legally incorporated under the laws of the state in which they are located.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: An incorporated place in all states (not Hawaii) and the District of Columbia.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: A type of incorporated place in Alaska.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: A type of incorporated place in Pennsylvania and Alaska.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: An incorporated place in 30 States. In some states, the Census Bureau treats these towns as a type of minor civil division.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

edom.edomvd: An incorporated place in 20 States. The Census Bureau treats villages in some states as county subdivisions.
edom.edomvds: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the city is located.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The code (two-digit number) for the state in which the city is located.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas

attr.attrdef: The combined state and populated place Census codes. Use the combined code (seven-digit number) to uniquely identify a city.

codesetd.codesetn: INCITS 38-2009, (Formerly FIPS 5-2) Codes for the Identification of the States and Equivalent Areas within the United States, Puerto Rico, and the Insular Areas; Federal Information Processing Standards Pub 55
codesetd.codesets: American National Standards Institute; U.S. Department of Commerce

attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau

attr.attrdef: The code for the 2020 population class of the city.
The 2020 population of the city per square mile.
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Commerce, Census Bureau; Esri

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The area of the city in square miles using the North America Albers Equal Area Conic projection.
The national or state capital city indicator.

edom.edomvd: The city is the national capital.
The city is a state capital.
The city is not a state or national capital.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the Esri Sales staff at +1-800-447-9778 or visit https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=1 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0.

digtinfo.formcont: To use this data requires software that works with FGDB files.

stdorder.ordering: Data and Maps is available only as part of ArcGIS® software.
